abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Second Land
            Administration and Management Project for Philippines are to
            increase land tenure security and improve land
            administration services through the implementation of
            institutional and legal reform, the realization of an
            accelerated land titling program, and the establishment of a
            fair and uniform property valuation system. The extension is
            necessary to complete and/or undertake the remaining project
            activities. These include: a) development of policy
            guidelines on cost and fees for computerized verification
            and inter-agency data sharing; b) continuing support to
            property valuation activities; c) continuing support to
            professional regulatory board of real estate services; d)
            continuing support to formation of a professional valuers
            body; and e) continuing support for information and
            education on the valuation reform act bill in the 15th
            congress until enacted. A revised project implementation
            plan that covers up to the revised loan closing date of
            December 31, 2012 has been prepared by the project and found
            acceptable by the task team. This will be the second
            extension of the project.
